newsitem.title: USA: Assets of U.S. money market funds fell in week.
newsitem.headline: Assets of U.S. money market funds fell in week.

text.p: Total money market mutual fund assets in the week ended March 12 fell to $970.84 billion from a revised $972.02 billion last week, an industry trade group said Thursday.
The Investment Company Institute said assets of the nation's 665 retail money market mutual funds rose $845.9 million to $642.55 billion in the week.

Of the retail funds, assets of the 402 taxable money market funds rose $679.7 million to $522.93 billion, while assets of the 263 tax-exempt funds rose $166.2 million to $119.62 billion, the group said.

ICI said assets of the 323 institutional money market funds fell $2.02 billion to $328.29 billion. Of these, assets of the 260 taxable money market funds decreased $2.33 billion to $294.49 billion, while assets of the 63 tax-exempt funds rose $306.6 million to $33.81 billion, it said.
ICI revised last week's money market mutual fund assets to $972.02 billion from $972.12 billion.
